title: Solskjaer reacts to Man Utd knocking Chelsea out and Marcus Rashford wondergoal
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s Manchester United knocked Chelsea out of the Carabao Cup (Picture: Getty)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer said Manchester United were ‘excellent’ during their hard-fought Carabao Cup victory over Chelsea.

Marcus Rashford scored a brace, including a sensational free-kick, as Manchester United clinched a 2-1 win at Stamford Bridge to reach the EFL Cup quarter-finals.

The England striker put United ahead on 25 minutes from the penalty spot after Daniel James was brought down by Blues defender Marcos Alonso.

Marcus Rashford scored a stunning free-kick at Stamford Bridge (Picture: AP)

Michy Batshuayi equalised for Frank Lampard’s side with a superb individual goal shortly after half-time but Rashford settled the affair with a stunning free-kick with 17 minutes remaining.

Reacting to the win and Rashford’s strike, Solskjaer told Sky Sports: ‘We’ve travelled a lot in the last week. We’ve got a good team spirit and camaraderie.

‘It shows the character of the team. We get the games where we want them. We’ve been leading 1-0 in many games and not kicked on.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Today we were excellent, with fast flowing flowing. That’s Manchester United. We’re trying to get back to that.

‘Marcus has that strike in him. I’ve seen him in training so many times.

‘When you give young lads the experience, like Brandon Williams got tonight – and the kid was outstanding – it’s only going to help them.

Solskjaer was not surprised by Rashford’s strike (Picture: EPA)

‘We know we’re not the finished product, we’re a work in progress and keep trying to improve.’

Rashford, meanwhile, said his superb strike was aided by the balls used during the match.

‘To be honest, it was the balls,’ he said. ‘When we were training with them and we were shooting there was this up and down motion and they can go anywhere.

‘Thankfully, today it went in the top corner. It is a positive day.’

On Manchester United’s start to the season, Rashford added: ‘We’ve been in a tough place. We’re still getting through that phase.

‘The only way to get through it is to fight through it and win because they’re the things which keep everyone happy. When you’ve won, you wake up with a good feeling. The main focus was improvement and development.’
